snippet: State budget writers on Thursday approved a $1.4 billion increase for public education in the first clear signal that the new Legislature may pour money back into public schools.
abstract: Budget writers in Texas State Senate approve $1.4 billion increase for public education, two years after cutting spending to schools by $5.4 billion; it is first clear signal that new Legislature may pour money back into public schools.
lead_paragraph: State budget writers on Thursday approved a $1.4 billion increase for public education in the first clear signal that the new Legislature may pour money back into public schools.

headline.main: Texas: Plan Would Reverse Some Cuts in School Funds
headline.print_headline: Texas: Plan Would Reverse Some Cuts In School Funds
